channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bryson DeChambeau wins another U.S. Open with a clutch finish to deny Rory McIlroy
item.description: Bryson DeChambeau won the U.S. Open on Sunday for the second time with the best shot of his life. Meanwhile, it was another heavy dose of heartache for Rory McIlroy.
item.content:encoded:
Bryson DeChambeau won the U.S. Open on Sunday for the second time with the best shot of his life. Meanwhile, it was another heavy dose of heartache for Rory McIlroy.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Tony Awards 2024: The complete list of winners
item.description: It was a crowded season this year, with 36 eligible musicals and plays opening on Broadway stages. Here are the winners of the 77th Tony Awards.
item.content:encoded:
It was a crowded season this year, with 36 eligible musicals and plays opening on Broadway stages. Here are the winners of the 77th Tony Awards.

(Image credit: Charles Sykes)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: President Biden and former President Trump face off in CNN debate next week
item.description: Next week, President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on CNN. The network announced the rules this weekend.
item.content:encoded: Next week, President Joe Biden and former president Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on CNN. The network announced the rules this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Could the U.K. election mean an off-ramp from personality politics?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Matthew Holehouse, British political correspondent for The Economist, about the upcoming UK election.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Matthew Holehouse, British political correspondent for The Economist, about the upcoming UK election.

item.title: National security expert warns that extreme weather threatens democracy
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Alice Hill, a former senior director for resilience policy on the National Security Council, about how extreme weather threatens elections globally.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Alice Hill, a former senior director for resilience policy on the National Security Council, about how extreme weather threatens elections globally.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: A fast-moving wildfire spreads north of Los Angeles, forcing evacuations
item.description: The fire, which scorched over 12,000 acres in less than a day, has forced the evacuation of about 1,200 people, California fire officials said. The blaze was 2% contained as of Sunday afternoon.
item.content:encoded:
The fire, which scorched over 12,000 acres in less than a day, has forced the evacuation of about 1,200 people, California fire officials said. The blaze was 2% contained as of Sunday afternoon.

(Image credit: Eric Thayer)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Millions from the Midwest to the Northeast prepare for a weeklong heat wave
item.description: A sweltering heat wave is bearing down on a large swath of the U.S., creating potentially dangerous conditions for millions of people in multiple states.
item.content:encoded:
A sweltering heat wave is bearing down on a large swath of the U.S., creating potentially dangerous conditions for millions of people in multiple states.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Brazil's far-right introduces bill that equates abortion after 22 weeks to murder
item.description: Protests have broken out across Brazil after lawmakers attempted to fast track legislation that would equate abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy to murder.
item.content:encoded: Protests have broken out across Brazil after lawmakers attempted to fast track legislation that would equate abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy to murder.
item.dc:creator: Julia Carneiro

item.title: Muslims in Gaza pass a somber Eid al-Adha on the brink of famine
item.description: Muslims around the world are celebrating Eid al-Adha, the Feast of the Sacrifice. But in Gaza, which aid groups say is on the brink of famine, food is hard to come by this year let alone meat.
item.content:encoded: Muslims around the world are celebrating Eid al-Adha, the Feast of the Sacrifice. But in Gaza, which aid groups say is on the brink of famine, food is hard to come by this year let alone meat.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: 3 Americans are on trial for a failed coup in the Democratic Republic of Congo
item.description: In the Democratic Republic of Congo, three Americans are among dozens of people on trial for a failed coup attempt. NPR's Lauren Frayer talks to independent journalist Emmet Livingstone.
item.content:encoded: In the Democratic Republic of Congo, three Americans are among dozens of people on trial for a failed coup attempt. NPR's Lauren Frayer talks to independent journalist Emmet Livingstone.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
